meanings.definition: The quality of being easily shaped or molded.
meanings.sent1: The plasticity of the clay allowed the artist to create intricate sculptures.
meanings.sent2: The plasticity of the material made it perfect for crafting various shapes.
meanings.sent3: The plasticity of the dough made it fun to play with in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her mind showed great plasticity, adapting easily to new ideas like clay taking shape.
meanings.sent5: The plasticity of the putty made it stretch and bend like a rubber band.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily influenced or changed.
meanings.sent1: His plasticity in decision-making often led him to follow others' suggestions.
meanings.sent2: The plasticity of her opinions showed her open-mindedness.
meanings.sent3: The plasticity of his excuses was amusing, always changing to fit the situation.
meanings.sent4: Her plasticity in adapting to new environments was like a chameleon changing colors.
meanings.sent5: The plasticity of his beliefs made him easily swayed by persuasive arguments.

meanings.definition: The capacity to recover from deformation.
meanings.sent1: The plasticity of the rubber band allowed it to bounce back after being stretched.
meanings.sent2: The plasticity of the material ensured it could return to its original shape.
meanings.sent3: The plasticity of the toy's form made it amusing to watch it regain its shape.
meanings.sent4: Her resilience showed a remarkable plasticity, bouncing back from setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The plasticity of the memory foam pillow let it adjust to the sleeper's position.
